newsitem.title: USA: New Jersey releases electric deregulation proposal.
newsitem.headline: New Jersey releases electric deregulation proposal.

text.p: New Jersey Board of Public Utilities (BPU) Thursday released its electricity deregulation proposal which aims to give some retail customers the option of choosing their energy suppliers starting in October, 1998.
The plan will be expanded to allow all retail electric customers to choose their electricity providers by April 2001, BPU said.
BPU said the restructuring plan, which still needs final approval in the state legislature, is expected to reduce near-term electric rates by five to 10 percent.
